article:
Washing clothes, folding  quilts, and _ steamed buns   ... these were difficult for Liang Jingwei before. But after he took some living skill   classes, they are easy for this 12-year-old student at Weifang Experimental School, Shandong.
"At one time, my parents had to help me _ these things. But now, I can do it all by _ ," he said.
Many middle schools opened selective classes   to teach students living skills. At Liang's school, students take a one-week long class. Eight students live in the dormitory  to learn the skills. " Many of them are spoiled   at home. They don't know about necessary living skills. These classes make up for that," said Zhang Jing, Liang's teacher. Liang even tried making yogurt. "My yogurt tastes delicious," he said proudly.
There are some other classes such as cooking, tea art and financial management  . The students must take those classes once a week for 60 minutes in a school year. All these classes have _ in common. They all try to teach students some important skills for life.
Another student, Zhang Yuanfan got better at cutting vegetables _ the cooking class. But to keep those skills, she practices every day. "It's not easy. I understand my mother _ ," she said. Now, she often cooks at home.
"These classes also help students enjoy their life," Chen Siyu, Zhang's cooking teacher said.
